start.text: The receptionist's counter.
Your office.
The Dean's office.
It's locked.
(You look at the bulletin board.)
(Clinic hours, honor certificates, mental health tips, job hiring...)
(A flyer on Hypnotherapy... This is the therapy Father has been practicing and promoting his whole life.)

locked_machine_node.text: (You should talk to the patient first.)

unlocked_machine_node.text: (After you check that the machine is functinal, you carefully place it on her head.)

start.speaker: narrator
start.text: (Upon contact, fragmented images flash before you—an office, a computer screen.

start.speaker: narrator
start.text: You witness her endlessly revising the proposal, her earlier account now visceral in first-person. The relentless edits radiate palpable distress.

start.speaker: player
start.text: (......Experiencing her perspective is overwhelming.)

start.speaker: narrator
start.text: (The scene shifts to a classroom. )

start.speaker: narrator
start.text: (The classroom was abuzz with talk, seizing the moment while the teacher was away.)

start.speaker: narrator
start.text: (Lowering the gaze reveals impeccably organized notes—neat lines, elegant handwriting, clear highlights. A model of perfection.)

start.speaker: player
start.text: (Her perfectionism traces back to high school......?)

start.speaker: narrator
start.text: (A voice interrupts.)

start.speaker: narrator
start.text: ??: Zheng! Can I borrow your notes?

start.speaker: narrator
start.text: (The views shift left—to her deskmate.)

start.speaker: narrator
start.text: (Zheng moves her hand, which had obscured part of the page, to reveal the pristine notes.)

start.speaker: narrator
start.text: ??: As perfect as always! No wonder you're our top student.

start.speaker: Zheng
start.text: ......It's just what I should do.

start.speaker: narrator
start.text: ??: I'll borrow them, thanks!

start.speaker: narrator
start.text: (The scene is an office again—but not her workplace.)

start.speaker: player
start.text: (Another office? Whose is this?)

start.speaker: narrator
start.text: (A male voice is heard.)

start.speaker: narrator
start.text: ?:  Thanks for waiting.

start.speaker: player
start.text: (This voice......)

start.speaker: narrator
start.text: (Her view turns, revealing a face you know.)

start.speaker: player
start.text: (Father?!)

start.speaker: player
start.text: (Why is he in her memory?)

start.speaker: Zheng
start.text: Good afternoon, Professor.

start.speaker: Dean
start.text: Good afternoon. I called you here to propose something.

start.speaker: Dean
start.text: I'm running a psychology experiment, but I'm short on staff.

start.speaker: Dean
start.text: Your diligence and precision are exactly what this experiment needs.

start.speaker: Dean
start.text: I know your ideal is achieve something in psychology, right? This could be your first step.

start.speaker: player
start.text: (She studied under him? What a coincidence......)

start.speaker: Zheng
start.text: Of course, it would be my honor, Professor.

start.speaker: narrator
start.text: (This memory is blurry—snatches of conversations and report writing. Words on the reports catch your eye.)

start.speaker: player
start.text: (Hypnotherapy Results......? Is this the “experiment”?)

start.speaker: narrator
start.text: (You read the report—overwhelming with technical terms.)

start.speaker: narrator
start.text: (Reports pile up, dense with jargon. The first, the second, the third... All share one conclusion:)

start.speaker: narrator
start.text: (Failure)

start.speaker: narrator
start.text: (A sense of unease—and inexplicable familiarity—washes over you.)

start.speaker: narrator
start.text: (As the memory fades, you find something in your hand)

start.speaker: narrator
start.text: (A notebook. But no tidy lines, no neat notes, no highlights—just blank pages.)

start.speaker: narrator
start.text: (Perhaps emptiness, too, is a form of perfection.)

start.speaker: narrator
start.text: (But who defines perfection? Who enforces it?)

start.speaker: narrator
start.text: You're no philosopher. No need to dwell on that.

start.speaker: player
start.text: (This is Ms. Zheng's emotional anchor......)

start.speaker: player
start.text: Destroy it, and her symptoms vanish—but so do parts of her memory.

start.speaker: player
start.text: Keep it, and the cure may be incomplete. What should I choose?)
